thread.title: Ivanka Trump Says Nordstrom Only Cut Her Collection Online, Not in Stores
thread.title_full: Ivanka Trump Says Nordstrom Only Cut Her Collection Online, Not in Stores

author: Cosmopolitan.com
title: Ivanka Trump Says Nordstrom Only Cut Her Collection Online, Not in Stores
text:
Ivanka Trump's team has denied a report that Nordstrom dropped her fashion line (including shoes, apparel, and jewelry), telling Refinery29 that they remain in business with the department store.
"Nordstrom ordered both apparel and shoes for the spring, and followed through with the order for the apparel," a spokesperson for the brand told Refinery29. "They canceled the shoe order, kept the apparel order, and moved the apparel from online into stores. It's there." If that's true, it would seem to imply that Nordstrom is just keeping up appearances online to placate #GrabYourWallet boycotters .
Advertisement - Continue Reading Below The drama doesn't stop there. Nordstrom's original statement made it seem like poor "performance" was the reason behind dropping Ivanka's line but that's not the whole story. Sources close to the situation explained to Refinery29, "They couldn't handle the political pressure, someone new came in, and there was a change in the attitude toward the brand."
According to a Racked article published today, another major retailer, Neiman Marcus, ceased carrying Ivanka Trump jewelry shortly after Nordstrom's decision made headlines. Neiman Marcus and Nordstrom were two of the 10 top brands targeted by the GrabYourWallet group, which began taking action after President Trump's infamous "pussy" commentary.
Despite this news, reps for Ivanka Trump's line insist the brand is growing. "The Ivanka Trump brand continues to expand across categories and distribution with increased customer support, leading us to experience significant year-over-year revenue growth in 2016," Rosemary K. Young, Ivanka Trump's senior director of marketing told Refinery29. "We believe that the strength of a brand is measured not only by the profits it generates, but the integrity it maintains."
Of course, Young's statement could just be alternative facts.
